div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 15:54 pm CDT

div.div: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. South wind 10 to 13 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 78. South southwest wind 5 to 10 mph becoming light and variable.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms, then showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm after 4am. Increasing clouds, with a low around 55. Light and variable wind becoming south 5 to 9 mph in the evening. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

div.p: Virtual 2020 Graduation Ceremony to be held on May 17th, at 2:00P.M.
(Class of 2020 guardians, you will be getting a detailed letter in the mail soon to help make this possible.)

To be sure we are able to give a meaningful, yet safe graduation for the Class of 2020, LDNE administration and our senior class sponsor Mrs. Mace, have been working closely with one another and the Elkhorn Logan Valley Public Health Department. Based on the measures the health department has set, we will be holding a virtual graduation ceremony on Sunday, May 17th @ 2PM.

It is our intention to pre-record the entire ceremony prior to this date. This will include administration speeches, class officer speeches, and Salutatorian and Valedictorian speeches as well. We will attempt to follow the exact same format from past Lyons-Decatur Northeast graduation ceremonies. The video, or the link to our video, will be found on the school Facebook page and school website for the community to watch safely in their homes.

At 3:15 P.M.- we are giving our seniors an option to "drive safely" around the Lyons community. We ask the citizens of Lyons to step outside your front doors and give them a much deserved round of applause as they drive by. Listen for the fire truck sirens who will be escorting them!
At 4:30 P.M.- we will do the same "cruise" in Decatur. Listen for the sirens!
OTHER EVENTS LEADING UP TO GRADUATION:
April-May: Two seniors a week have been/are showcased in the Lyons-Mirror Sun
Friday, May 1st: First National Bank Northeast will begin showing senior pictures on their screen outside the building. Be sure to check it out!!
KiX Radio Station Radio Campaign (Details to come)
Burt County Plaindealer will do a senior spread. -May 26th edition
Virtual Athletic Banquet (Dates will be announced on school website/ social media)
Virtual Academic Awards (Dates will be announced on school website/social media)
Virtual Baccalaureate: Hosted by 1st Presbyterian Church at 7:00 P.M.

a.aria-label: Read more about 2020 Virtual Graduation - May 17th @ 2:00p.m.

font.imgsrc:
This explains what to do if you believe you have been treated unfairly. "In accordance with Federal law and U.S. Department of Agriculture policy, this institution is prohibited from discriminating on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability.
To file a complaint of discrimination, write USDA, Director, Office of Civil Rights, 1400 Independence Avenue, S.W., Washington, D.C. 20250-9410 or call toll free (866) 632-9992 (voice). Individuals who are hearing impaired or have speech disabilities may contact USDA through the Federal Relay Service at (800) 877-8339 or (800) 845-6136 (Spanish). USDA is an equal opportunity provider and employer."
